content.description: Simple warm-up route on the far right side of the smaller of the two slabs. Use the arete to make it a little easier or stick with the face holds for a slightly slabbier experience. Simple top-out with good holds to use.
content.location: Far right side of the swamp slabs.

content.description: Slightly more difficult than Swamp Right, but still a warm-up route that you can cruise up easily. Top out still quite simple.
content.location: Middle section of the right/shorter swamp slab.

content.description: Just to the left of the second tree, this problem starts to become slightly more challenging than the other two. Requires some underclings towards the top and the top out is a bit more mantle-y than the other two with subpar holds.
content.location: Left side of the right/shorter slab

content.description: Crux is the first six feet or so. The feet are much smaller than the other slab and handholds above the first crack are pretty mediocre, making it a bit of a challenge to move above the crack. Top-out is fine.**Avoid using the blocks marked in the pic. They certainly make the problem easier, but they were shifting with even a small amount of weight on them and it could be very dangerous if they came out**
content.location: Left / taller of the two slabs.

content.description: A pair of undeveloped tall slabs inside the Greenwich Land Trust, a couple minutes west of the Old Man of Thorns.There's also a problem between the two slabs that I haven't been able to put together yet, but is pretty cool. It would start in a cave with your body parallel to the ground on the big block between the two slabs.
